description: (information measure): Defined by Myron Tribus in the 1961 book Thermostatics and Thermodynamics.

entries.meaning: (obsolete, military) A surprise attack or ambush; a sudden or unexpected assault. [16th–19th c.]
examples: Their chiefe attempts are by Stratagems, trecheries, or surprisals.

entries.meaning: (obsolete) A sudden coming-upon someone or something unexpectedly or unawares. [17th c.]
(obsolete) A surprising event or occurrence. [17th–19th c.]
(obsolete) The feeling caused by being surprised; surprise, shock, amazement. [17th–19th c.]
An information measure as equal in bits (binary digits) to the base-2 log of 1 over the probability, with the result that the number of choices equals 2n where n is the number of bits.
